alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 11:30AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST/630 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MST Wednesday /630 PM MDT Wednesday/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM MST /1228 PM MDT/, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the advisory area. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Porter Creek, Hog Wash, Show Low Creek, Silver Creek, Billy Creek, Linden Draw and Walnut Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Show Low, Wagon Wheel, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Fool Hollow Lake Campground, Scott Reservoir Campground and Lakeside Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 345 and 349. Highway 60 between mile markers 340 and 341. State Route 77 near mile marker 354. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
